attributes.action: review planning policy relating to Gypsy and Traveller sites as set out in Circular 01/06 that allows applications for sites to be approved in non-sustainable locations and where there is no proven local need.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
That the Government should review planning law and policy as set out in
Circular 01/06 relating to applications for gypsy and traveller sites.  This
policy, coupled with what have become unreasonable timetables to meet
regionally enhanced targets for pitches, delays in government grants to
local authorities to fund pitches, and the apparently unbalanced application
of Human Rights Legislation, has become discriminatory against settled communities.  As a result Local Authorities are having difficulties in establishing Gypsy and Traveller sites in appropriate locations and planning permissions are being granted in rural 'exception' sites in unsustainable locations (where there is a strong planning presumption against development and where there is no clear and established evidence of local need) to the detriment of settled communities
